name: Mi Testimonial Slider
author: Mi Plugins

sections.description:
Show your clients testimonials in stylish 20+ ways in the easiest and quickest way on your site. Just add this shortcode ‘[mi-testimonial id=”45752″]’ where you need to display, you will find this shortcode in the Mi Testimnial Slider setting panel.

  • Demo
  • Support
  • Pro

Mi Testimonial Slider have 5 different display types

  • Carousel
  • Grid Layout
  • Filter Layout
  • Combo Slider One
  • Combo Slider Two

And it have 5 different Layout Styles.

  • Style One
  • Style Two
  • Style Three
  • Style Four
  • Style Five

Mi Testimonial Slider is highly customizable

Mi Testimonial Slider have powerful option page to customize it, you can customize lot of things like:

  • Grid building
  • Responsive grid building
  • Slider items
  • Responsive slider items
  • Adding category to display filter layout
  • Changing colors
  • Changing slider nav/dot colors
  • Changing background colors
  • Changing display types
  • Changing display styles
  • And many more…

Mi Testimonial Slider Features

  • Simple and light weight
  • Very light weight
  • Fully responsive
  • Easy to customise
  • WordPress image uploader
  • Built in shortcode ready
  • No need any settings if you don’t want
  • Work with all WordPress theme
  • Ability to add Image, Name, Quote, Designation, 5 star Rating to each testimonial
  • Easy to use
  • Mobile touch
  • Advance settings panel with all necessary options.
  • Slider navigation, pagination, color settings.
  • Display Testimonials as carousel, filter mode, grid layout, list layout, comboslides.
  • Well documentation and support

Mi Testimonial Slider Pro

This is the free version of Mi Testimonial Slider, lot of features are not available in the free version, Get Mi Testimonial Slider Pro if you need the following advance features:

  • Multiple Testimoinal
  • Style Two
  • Style Three
  • Style Four
  • Style Five
  • Filter Layout
  • Combo Slider One
  • Combo Slider Two
sections.installation:
Install Mi Testimonial Slider as a regular WordPress plugin. Here is different ways to install Mi Testimonial slider plugin

  • Install by Search Plugin –
  • In your Admin, go to menu Plugins > Add New
  • Search Mi Testimonial Slider
  • Click to install

  • Activate the plugin

  • Install by Upload Plugin –
    Download the latest version of Mi Testimonial Slider (.zip file)
    In your Admin, go to menu Plugins > Add New
    Select Upload Plugin
    Click on Choose File
    Select downloaded mi-testimonial-slider.zip & click on Install Now button
    Activate the plugin

  • Install Plugin using FTP –
    Upload mi-testimonial-slider folder inside the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
    Go to WordPress dashboard > Plugins & Activate the Mi Testimonial Slider
sections.faq:
Installation Instructions

Install Mi Testimonial Slider as a regular WordPress plugin. Here is different ways to install Mi Testimonial slider plugin

  • Install by Search Plugin –
  • In your Admin, go to menu Plugins > Add New
  • Search Mi Testimonial Slider
  • Click to install

  • Activate the plugin

  • Install by Upload Plugin –
    Download the latest version of Mi Testimonial Slider (.zip file)
    In your Admin, go to menu Plugins > Add New
    Select Upload Plugin
    Click on Choose File
    Select downloaded mi-testimonial-slider.zip & click on Install Now button
    Activate the plugin

  • Install Plugin using FTP –
    Upload mi-testimonial-slider folder inside the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
    Go to WordPress dashboard > Plugins & Activate the Mi Testimonial Slider

How can I use this in a widget?

Just place the shortcode into a text widget. If that doesn’t work (it just renders [mi-testimonial id=”sdf454df”] in text) then that means your theme isn’t ‘widgetized’ which you can fix easily by adding 1 tiny piece of code to your theme functions.php:

add_filter('widget_text', 'do_shortcode');

Add this code above to fuctions.php between the <?php and ?> tags. A good place would be either at the very top or the very bottom of the file. Once you’ve done this you should be able to use shortcode in widgets now.

The layout is broken

It’s most likely just a matter of tweaking the css.

Where can I get support for this plugin?

If you’ve tried all the obvious stuff and it’s still not working please request support via Our forum.
